Summary: 5 amber lights in diagonal formation as one faded in the one behind faded out
divs: sighting detailson tuesday january 8th at around 6:45 pm i went outside to plug in the outdoor lights. as i bent down to pick up the cord to my left (east south east) i saw a flickering orange\amber colored light fading out. as it faded out, from my veiwing point about 2 inches directly to the north of it( dont know how that converts in the sky) a second light faded in at the same rate of the other fading out. it repeated this 3 more times, each light was equaly spaced from the light befor it creating a diagonal line. i live in a fairly rural area so it is very unlikly to be a comercial plane because the only time we see planes arounf here is if they are 30000 ft up of crop dusting. i am used to seeing lots of shooting stars out here, but this was very very different then anything i had ever seen.
trends: There have been no other sightings in Putnam
This sighting has never been favorited.
